ivardefs.name: authorizingPrescription_
ivardefs.desc: Indicates the medication order that is being dispensed against.

ivardefs.name: category
ivardefs.desc: Indicates the type of medication dispense (for example, where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered (i.e. inpatient or outpatient)).

ivardefs.name: context
ivardefs.desc: The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this event.

ivardefs.name: daysSupply
ivardefs.desc: The amount of medication expressed as a timing amount.

ivardefs.name: destination
ivardefs.desc: Identification of the facility/location where the medication was shipped to, as part of the dispense event.

ivardefs.name: detectedIssue_
ivardefs.desc: Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. drug-drug interaction, duplicate therapy, dosage alert etc.

ivardefs.name: dosageInstruction_
ivardefs.desc: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

ivardefs.name: eventHistory_
ivardefs.desc: A summary of the events of interest that have occurred, such as when the dispense was verified.

ivardefs.name: identifier_
ivardefs.desc: Identifiers associated with this Medication Dispense that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the pe

ivardefs.name: location
ivardefs.desc: The principal physical location where the dispense was performed.

ivardefs.name: note_
ivardefs.desc: Extra information about the dispense that could not be conveyed in the other attributes.

ivardefs.name: partOf_
ivardefs.desc: The procedure that trigger the dispense.

ivardefs.name: performer_
ivardefs.desc: Indicates who or what performed the event.

ivardefs.name: quantity
ivardefs.desc: The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.

ivardefs.name: receiver_
ivardefs.desc: Identifies the person who picked up the medication.  This will usually be a patient or their caregiver, but some cases exist where it can be a healthcare professional.

ivardefs.name: status
ivardefs.desc: A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events.

ivardefs.name: subject
ivardefs.desc: A link to a resource representing the person or the group to whom the medication will be given.

ivardefs.name: substitution
ivardefs.desc: Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense.  In some cases, substitution will be expected but does not happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen.  This block explains what substitution did or did not h

ivardefs.name: supportingInformation_
ivardefs.desc: Additional information that supports the medication being dispensed.

ivardefs.name: type
ivardefs.desc: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. For example, Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

ivardefs.name: whenHandedOver
ivardefs.desc: The time the dispensed product was provided to the patient or their representative.

ivardefs.name: whenPrepared
ivardefs.desc: The time when the dispensed product was packaged and reviewed.

properties.desc: Indicates that a medication product is to be or has been dispensed for a named person/patient.  This includes a description of the medication product (supply) provided and the instructions for administering the medication.  The medication dispense is the
